entry.title: Hardwyn India Limited Explains Delay in Q2 FY2026 Financial Results Submission
entry.content:
Top News
Hardwyn India Limited Explains Delay in Q2 FY2026 Financial Results Submission 6 hours ago
Hardwyn India Limited addressed the delay in submitting its financial results for Q3 2025 ending September 30. The company cited multiple board meeting adjournments due to lack of quorum, unforeseen circumstances, and the need for financial figure reconciliation. The statutory auditors required additional time for review. The board meeting was finally conducted on November 19, 2025, with results submitted thereafter. Hardwyn emphasized the delay was unintentional and reaffirmed its commitment to regulatory compliance.

entry.title: Ace Software Exports Secures Major AI-Driven Mortgage Platform Deal
entry.content:
Ace Software Exports Secures Major AI-Driven Mortgage Platform Deal 1 hour ago
Ace Software Exports Limited has landed a multi-phase product engineering contract worth approximately $1.5 million (INR 13.49 Crore) in the AI-driven mortgage marketplace sector. The initial purchase order is $48,000 for the MVP phase. The project involves developing an AI-driven mortgage marketplace platform for a US-based private equity firm, using a dedicated Global Capability Centre (GCC) delivery model. This engagement comes as the company reports significant financial growth, with total assets increasing by 168.14% and shareholders' capital by 185.04% over the past year.

entry.title: Nifty and Sensex Close Higher: IndiGo, Reliance Industries in Focus
entry.content:
Nifty and Sensex Close Higher: IndiGo, Reliance Industries in Focus 1 day ago
Indian markets ended positive with Nifty 50 at 26,180.90 (+0.57%) and Sensex at 85,698.74 (+0.51%). Market breadth was negative with 2,636 declining stocks out of 4,512 traded. IndiGo announced customer service initiatives, Reliance Industries saw significant block trades and a credit rating upgrade, while Lupin received FDA approval for a generic drug. Apollo Micro Systems projected strong revenue growth, and Chambal Fertilisers reported increased promoter shareholding.

entry.title: ICICI Prudential AMC Announces IPO Price Band, Signaling Strong Market Position
entry.content:
ICICI Prudential AMC Announces IPO Price Band, Signaling Strong Market Position 9 hours ago
ICICI Prudential Asset Management Company has set the price band for its initial public offering at ₹2,061 to ₹2,165 per equity share, with a minimum bid lot of 6 shares. The company's financial data shows growth, with total assets increasing by 5.22% to ₹308,847.00 crore and investments growing by 4.92% to ₹304,054.00 crore over the past year. The IPO is expected to attract significant investor interest due to the company's strong market position in India's asset management industry.
